things.thing

Interface ThingWriter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InMemoryConnector, XstreamConnector

    public interface ThingWriter

    A ThingWriter is a backend component that is able to persist things.

    In most cases this will be a connector to a database, or filesystem storage of some sort.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <V> Thing<V> addChild(Thing<?> parent, Thing<V> child)
      Adds a parent-child relationship for the two provided objects.
      boolean deleteThing(String id, Optional<String> type, Optional<String> key)
      Delete the thing with the specified id.
      <V> Thing<V> saveThing(Thing<V> t)
      Persists this thing.

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        <V> Thing<V> addChild(Thing<?> parent,
                      Thing<V> child)

        Adds a parent-child relationship for the two provided objects.

        Internally, a parent reference should be stored on the child object, not the other way around. Since this particular writer might not have the ability to ensure the persistence of the parent thing.

        Parameters:
        parent - the parent
        child - the child
        Returns:
        the child (most likely the same object as the input-child, but can’t be guaranteed

      • deleteThing

        boolean deleteThing(String id,
                    Optional<String> type,
                    Optional<String> key)

        Delete the thing with the specified id.

        The Type and Key arguments are optional. They are used to speed up finding the appropriate ThingWriter (using ThingWriters), without having to invoke all of them.

        Parameters:
        id - the id of the thing
        type - the (optional) type
        key - the (optional) key
        Returns:
        whether the thing was successfully deleted (true) or not (false)

      • saveThing

        <V> Thing<V> saveThing(Thing<V> t)

        Persists this thing.

        Parameters:
        t - the thing
        Returns:
        the reference to the persisted thing. It is advised to always use that from the moment of calling this method, it can’t be guaranteed that the old thing is not obsolete
